channel.title: Runescape: Hacked?
channel.description: A few minutes ago, all Runescape servers dropped to 0 players after an intense lag in-game. The lag dropped from the normal 800~ fps to less than 1, which then crashed every server. They are back and returning to normal stability, but what caused this? Somebody spill coffee on a server disk or did somebody purposely crash them?

item.title: Runescape: Hacked?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Chimaera God:

You can’t hack the army’s network… I should know. My mom’s best friend is a computer tech in the army, he says it’s one of the most advanced networks in the world.

Its possible, anything is possible when it comes to computers. Just very unlikely.

Read full topic

Aaron_9997:

there are many ways to hack runescape. You have to know what you are doing. My Mom knows a guy who hacks the the army all his life, hacking something like Runescape wont be as easy but it is very possible. You’d have to know how to hack, what to hack into and not to get caught.

…thats bull crap. do you even know what os the army runs on? So stop lying fool.

item.title: Runescape: Hacked?
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

[quote=“S!ms, post:49, topic:170714”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=230672.msg1977670#msg1977670 date=1199528779]
Fellix, you’re making no sense, and you’re making yourself look stupid again. Just… stop.

The ‘master server’ idea, was some-what true. Every account is run by one server, where as there’s 159 game servers. When you log out to switch to a different world, your character is moved back to the main server, which then is moved to the new server. That’s why is takes 30~ seconds to change worlds. But to be able to hack that and crash it, that would take many years of experience. Who would really waste their time doing it?
[/quote]

Seriously, do you really think there is one server where 452985719899 characters are stored? You can never rely on one server. Prove: some people couldnt login for a while, where others could. That server was down where 1% of the people were, the other 99% were stored on 99 other servers. (Just for example, no one knows the real amounts)[/quote]
He doesnt mean another runescape server. Maybe a mysql server?..

Anyways, theres no reason i can think of that would explain why they need this. If you can login to the same world immediately, you can login to another in the same time. Its just a part of the game so you can’t switch worlds and lets say mine rune ore continuously.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape: Hacked?
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

dumbolder:

It used to be that you could switch worlds immediately, so the 30s thing is only something they programmed to prevent people from world hopping to quick. As for the ‘moving’ character, I would think they just read stats from their database cluster and write them back when you log out, so you’re screwed if you just did a 10 hour straight

That’s true. Don’t you see stat updates until you logged out?

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape: Hacked?
item.dc:creator: @dumbolder dumbolder
item.description:
@dumbolder wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:45, topic:170714”]Fellix, you’re making no sense, and you’re making yourself look stupid again. Just… stop.

The ‘master server’ idea, was some-what true. Every account is run by one server, where as there’s 159 game servers. When you log out to switch to a different world, your character is moved back to the main server, which then is moved to the new server. That’s why is takes 30~ seconds to change worlds. But to be able to hack that and crash it, that would take many years of experience. Who would really waste their time doing it?[/quote]

It used to be that you could switch worlds immediately, so the 30s thing is only something they programmed to prevent people from world hopping to quick. As for the ‘moving’ character, I would think they just read stats from their database cluster and write them back when you log out, so you’re screwed if you just did a 10 hour straight

Read full topic
